title: Workshop on Language Learning Strategy Design Reflecting Individual Cognitive Differences

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning experience and intermediate-level domain expertise
context.additional_context: A practical course for learners composed of current practitioners to practice considering individual cognitive abilities in language education design

learning_goals: Learners can explain differentiated instructional strategies based on working memory (WM) capacity levels
Learners can design three or more activity sequences that reduce cognitive load in language learning design
Learners can develop language education scenarios applying Merrill’s instructional strategy model
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
